original_title: Sri Lanka links up with Korea for rural development
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Cabinet of Ministers has approved the signing of a tripartite Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between Korea’ s Saemaul Undong (New Village) Foundation in order to develop the local rural community in the country, a statement said.

The MoU will be signed between Sri Lanka Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial council and local government, Department of External Resources and the Saemaul Undong (New Village) Foundation.
The development programme is to provide infrastructure facilities, livelihoods, subsidiaries and educational development in ruralities across Sri Lanka.
The community-driven development programme had been adopted by the Republic of Korea in the 1970s, in an attempt to revitalize the rural sector and alleviate communities from poverty.

According to the Korean Embassy in Sri Lanka, in collaboration with the Foundation, the government has implemented projects in Hewadiwela, Pahalagama, Pitiyegama and Kegalle, of which two are Mushroom co-operative societies.

The previous development programme which had been agreed upon in a MOU in 2013 between the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council and Saemaul Undong Foundation, has now come to an end. (Colombo/ March 28/2023)
